content.description: Crux is off of the ground on this one. A few throws off of some crimps and you end up on easy terrain. Some people have pre-clipped the first bolt.
content.protection: Bolts were chopped on this route, can only TR now, sling tree on the left or use the Rawlhide anchors but just beware of large pendulum if you blow the opening sequence.
content.location: Bolted line on the left hand side of the Rawlhide Wall. Rap/lower down or walk off.

content.description: Climb the fun bolted (with Rawl brand bolts of course) line up the middle of the face.  Go up, wander right to first bolt, meander back left for the second, then blast up to the third and the top.
content.location: Middle of wall below Plane Above Your Head.

content.description:
Onsighting this bad boy would be challenging due to the beta intensive flow and the high first bolt. Pre-Clipping the first bolt is recommended until the beginning sequence is dialed.

This climb is one that (in my experience) lends itself to the vertically challenged climber due to the high feet throughout the route.
content.location: This route is located right of Rawlhide on Rawlhide Wall.

content.description: This route was never meant to be but because Rocky and Bullwinkle (5.10) (which is harder if you stay right of the chopped bolts) was bolted so close to Cro-Magnon Crack it became an easier way to climb this traditional route with an alternate finish.Therefore this squeeze job route was born. Enjoy, it is often a first lead for many first time sport leaders.Edit: The bolts on this line have been chopped so it can no longer be climbed on lead.
content.protection: Newly replaced anchor shared with Rawlhide.
content.location: Starts on the easy terrain left of Rawlhide

content.description: Climb the fun, too short left angling crack to the top.  Named because it is a step above the cave, man. There is an old mining tunnel (cave)down and right of this wall.  Well worth a visit, and spooky, even if it does smell like pee.
content.location: At left end of Rawlhide Wall, which is below Plane Above Your Head.

content.description:
Same start as Disgustipated but you traverse right on the seam with minimal feet. Make a long reach for the large undercling/roof and place some gear. The route now becomes Arborcide but is a hard (5.9) due to the traditional protection.

Climb to the large ledge and either walk off or make an anchor preferably on the boulder. There is a tree here but they are suppose to be illegal for anchors...
content.protection:
North Carolina Trad Rack, Natural Anchor.

Large Cams protect the undercling (BD #1-4).

Medium gear after pulling the undercling (BD #.5-.75)

climbs.name: Arborcide
climbs.fa: unsure, several of us claimed it at various times.....

content.description: Climb the face past an interesting small roof to the top.  A harder (5.11?) variation climbs a bit right of the line of least resistance.
content.location: At right side of Rawlhide Wall, above a stump (hence the name).
